abstract_summ: Many Sub-Saharan African nations are now facing increasing numbers of cases of COVID-19 . Senegal acted promptly to contain the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and as a result has reduced the reproduction number from 1.9 to 1.3 . Further reductions in contact rates to suppress transmission (Rt<1) could significantly reduce this burden on healthcare services and improve overall health outcomes . Depopulation, single celling, and asymptomatic testing within jails can be effective strategies .
